title: [QoL] Line skillshot indicator (projectile) : animations?
body:
Riot can you please make an animation with an arrow projecting out from your champion model to the end of the indicator, indicating the speed of the line skillshot? At least for champions with CC/movement impairing skillshots (non-targeted/AoE/non-dash). Abilities in marked with (#) are hard CC.

{{champion:22}} (W) technically..

Possible I missed some but I would appreciate it if this was a thing to help "lead" with your skillshot. Others will say this takes the skill out of skillshot but this really only applies when you are using indicators, not smart-cast.

replies.body: Basically useless, if you need this in the first place, you wont have time to wait and watch and will probably still miss. Anyone who has played the champ more than once simply wont need it.
Useless for you, maybe. Can't speak for everyone. Many pro players sometimes use indicators for certain abilities.

That would make a case for a lot of on-screen clutter and would be deemed highly unnecessary by Rioters Designers. 

I also think it may cause an uprise in bots/dodging scripts, since they would only need to look for the template (the skillshot indicator) to avoid the champions hitbox from connecting without needing to use server data to know that the enemy champion has queue'd and casted an ability, since the information is now given on the user's screen.

It wouldn't produce any more clutter, it's simply adding an animation to the already existing indicator. It's simply adding a "wave/pulse" onto the indicator. If it does produce clutter, can make it optional.
